body: It's not supported in mingw. See https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/786. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809)

comment_regular_data.body:
I'm not very familiar with special format strings like hex formatting, so I'm not very qualified to review this. Are you sure you can just drop `hh` in `%02hhX` and get the same output being printed?

Btw, I think the compiler is happy with just one `h`, it's two of them `hh` that the compiler doesn't know what to do.

---

Reviewed 19 of 19 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---

*[.travis.yml, line 43 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809#-L7IHn1rxbrqaOYnhCzk:-L7IHn1rxbrqaOYnhCzl:bu0gv1y) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0ea89768dcb3ab2e92256b0d6662ce99ab91277a/.travis.yml#L43)):*
> ```YAML
> #   group: deprecated-2017Q4
> #   services:
> #   - docker
> ```

You might want to enable both Windows arches, for some reason one of them complains about those formats more than another.

---

*[other/fun/strkey.c, line 89 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809#-L7IJmUWPw3eY-vgFKqe:-L7IJmUWPw3eY-vgFKqf:bkqz7kx) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0ea89768dcb3ab2e92256b0d6662ce99ab91277a/other/fun/strkey.c#L89)):*
> ```C
> 
>         for (i = 0; i < len; pos += 2) {
>             sscanf(pos, "%02x", &desired_bin[i]);
> ```

You are not using an intermediate `unsigned int` here for `sscanf` like you did in the bootstrap daemon or misc_tools.c? Not sure what is the purpose of it anyway, but I see you do this in one case but not in another very similar (the same) case.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809#-:-L7IKeMqIgN99h1P0sS_:bt2u8az)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Review status: 17 of 19 files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[.travis.yml, line 43 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809#-L7IHn1rxbrqaOYnhCzk:-L7JbXCsqj8M5nqU3Cib:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0ea89768dcb3ab2e92256b0d6662ce99ab91277a/.travis.yml#L43)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
You might want to enable both Windows arches, for some reason one of them complains about those formats more than another.
Done. --- *[other/fun/strkey.c, line 89 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809#-L7IJmUWPw3eY-vgFKqe:-L7JbXv-dQjg3wsovKRt:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/0ea89768dcb3ab2e92256b0d6662ce99ab91277a/other/fun/strkey.c#L89)):*
Previously, nurupo wrote…
You are not using an intermediate `unsigned int` here for `sscanf` like you did in the bootstrap daemon or misc_tools.c? Not sure what is the purpose of it anyway, but I see you do this in one case but not in another very similar (the same) case.
Done. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809)*

Yes, because these are all `unsigned char`, so it's the same. It becomes different if you pass in a value larger than `UCHAR_MAX`, because then the cast to `unsigned char` done in `printf` matters.

---

Review status: 17 of 19 files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed.

---



*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809#-:-L7Jb_MMVZv_cnJB2hwm:b9t7gpg)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

--- Reviewed 2 of 2 files at r2. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, all discussions resolved, some commit checks failed. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/809#-:-L7K2iHFB-ytp8yqB6Sv:b-jbsf8z)*

I noticed that it also doesn't know what the extra `l` in `%lld` is, [at least in here](https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/bd62d11860a4e6e540f7116f0ef6c56b28b18837/toxcore/Messenger.c#L1761), maybe somewhere more too, and [it doesn't like](https://travis-ci.org/TokTok/c-toxcore/jobs/351934515) that we use `%ld` to print `time_t` which is `long long int` on 64-bit arch.

commit.message:
Remove the use of the 'hh' format specifier.

It's not supported in mingw.

See https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/786.
